attributes.comment:
I am strongly opposed to raising filing fees at USCIS. Those wishing to adopt
internationally already face a great financial burden. When considering to raise
fees, I ask that you please think carefully if there may be another solution, such
as eliminating the need to file the I-600/600A (Petition to Classify Orphan as an
Immediate Relative) and having to get fingerprinted twice (or more for some having
to wait longer for a child) by extending the validity of the I-171H ("Notice of
Favorable Determination Concerning Application for Advanced Processing
of Orphan Petition"). It would seem that by eliminating the need to refile and get
refingerprinted would cut down on time and cost and could be a viable alternative
to raising fees.
Thank you for your consideration.
attributes.title: Comment Submitted by Erin Crowley
